DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Code 4'
DAFPT.answer: Request Wants and Warrants - Used to obtain a background check on a specific person or vehicle.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Code 12'
DAFPT.answer: Duress - Refers to any duress situation.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Code 16'
DAFPT.answer: Alarm Activation - Used to initiate an alarm activation.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

DAFPT.question: Define an Active Duress
DAFPT.answer: Active duress may be indicated by the use of electronic duress alarms to covertly advise another location/unit of a duress situation. Without alerting the person(s) causing the duress, that the alarm has been sounded. Other examples of active duress indicators include the passing of the wing duress word or failing to properly authenticate via the authentication code.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: Define a Passive Duress
DAFPT.answer: Passive Duress. Passive duress is three consecutive failures to respond to your radio call sign.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: What is the alternate channel used when notified of a Code 9?
DAFPT.answer: A Net - Channel 3
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: Under what jurisdiction does PSFB operate?
DAFPT.answer: Exclusive
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

DAFPT.question: Under what jurisdiction does CCSFS operate?
DAFPT.answer: Exclusive and proprietary
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

DAFPT.question: To what document would you refer to for specific jurisdictional boundaries.
DAFPT.answer: SLD 45 Integrated Defense Plan 31-1
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

DAFPT.question: When may a juvenile be issues a CVB 1805?
DAFPT.answer: Traffic infractions only
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

DAFPT.question: Patrols will issue what form to any person who has suffered direct physical, emotional or financial harm as a result of an offense.
DAFPT.answer: DD Form 2701
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM VICTIM AND WITNESS ASSISTANCE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.8

DAFPT.question: Bomb Threat: Name three of five types of IED's commonly used.
DAFPT.answer: Pyrotechnic, Electrical, Mechanical, Time Mechanism and Chemical
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What form is utilized to assist in capturing vital information during a telephone bomb threat?
DAFPT.answer: AF Form 440, Bomb Threat Aid
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Bomb Threat: Ensure radio transmissions are not made within _______ (distance) of the affected area.
DAFPT.answer: 50 feet
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Bomb Threat: If a detonation time is given, do not search within ______ (time) before or after the detonation time.
DAFPT.answer: 30 minutes
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Bomb Threat: An initial evacuation distance of ____________ for items up to box size (large briefcase/package - 2 cubic ft.).
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Bomb Threat: An initial evacuation distance of _______ for van or small truck.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Active Shooter - Phase 1
DAFPT.answer: Neutralize the threat(s)
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

DAFPT.question: Active Shotter - Phase 2
DAFPT.answer: PHASE II - Secure the immediate area (all threats to include IEDs)
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

DAFPT.question: Active Shooter - Phase 5
DAFPT.answer: Establish and preserve the crime scene
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Covered Wagon'
DAFPT.answer: COVERED WAGON reports inform HHQ that an unusual incident affecting PL 1, 2, or 3 resources, probably or actually hostile, occurred at an installation or dispersed site.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COVERED WAGON PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v3 Chap 2. Security Reporting and Alerting System

DAFPT.question: Whom may cancel a Covered Wagon report?
DAFPT.answer: Installation Commander or designee may cancel the COVERED WAGON incident.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COVERED WAGON PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v3 Chap 2. Security Reporting and Alerting System

DAFPT.question: True or False: SF/DAF CP patrol may assist local authorities as long as they do not engage in enforcement of civil law.
DAFPT.answer: True
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN MUTUAL AID POLICE RESPONSES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.14

DAFPT.question: What actions must you take during a launch mishap?
DAFPT.answer: Clearing Officers and all others on-duty take immediate cover in assigned vehicle, guard houses or other available shelter. All TCPs must remain hard down unless they feel their life is in danger, at which time they will leave the vehicle barriers in place, proceed to a pre-determined launch shelter, and notify the LOS upon arrival.
DAFPT.ref: XPLAIN LAUNCH OPERATIONS GENERAL INFORMATION - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.2.1-4.4.2

DAFPT.question: What document is utilized to aid in the purge of the FCA/BDA?
DAFPT.answer: Man-load list
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LAUNCH CLEARING OFFICER DUTIES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.1.3-4.1.3.5

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Hard Down'
DAFPT.answer: Ensure no one enters the area unless they are cleared through BDOC, Whiskey Control, and/or the LOS or the SL.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LAUNCH OPERATIONS POSTED TCP DUTIES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.1.5-4.1.5.6

DAFPT.question: The term ______ will be used when an individual deliberately drives past the IEC without being properly vetted.
DAFPT.answer: gate runner
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

DAFPT.question: The deployment of the Stinger Spike System must be authorized by whom?
DAFPT.answer: Flight Sergeant
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

DAFPT.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE THREE: Group Oriented Violence.
DAFPT.answer: This phase is characterized by roaming assaults on lone individuals and/or fights with opposing groups, or assembly of personnel at base entry points.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

DAFPT.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE FIVE: After-Confrontation Phase.
DAFPT.answer: This phase is characterized by the cessation of confrontational activities and close out of all administrative and legal actions regarding the disturbance.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

DAFPT.question: DoD Installations must provide Safe Haven for AA&E shipments during emergency conditions. What areas are designated for Safe Haven at PSFB and CCSFS?
DAFPT.answer: PSFB - Hot Cargo Pad (HCP) #1 & CCSFS - MSA #2
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY SAFE HAVEN PROCEDURES - 45 SWI 24-602-O Chap 5.1 Para 5.1.1-5.5.4

DAFPT.question: During an alarm response, the initial patrol arrives and establishes themselves at 'Point #1' of the facility. Where is he/she located?
DAFPT.answer: Left of the main entrance.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Cordon.'
DAFPT.answer: A cordon surrounds the accident area where controls are established to keep emergency responders safe and preclude unauthorized entry. Cordon sizes vary and will be decided by the IC or be predetermined by local guidance.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

DAFPT.question: Where should the Access Control Point (ACP) be established along the cordon of a hazardous incident?
DAFPT.answer: The ACP is established upwind or crosswind of the incident site and at the established evacuation distance.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

DAFPT.question: Who will assume initial IC (incident Command) for law and order and security related responses.
DAFPT.answer: The Senior SF Member
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

DAFPT.question: When conducting a sweep of an alarmed facility when an alarm has been activated and no personnel are on duty, what are patrols looking for?
DAFPT.answer: Signs of forced entry, out of place objects, etc.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

DAFPT.question: Who determines the size of an initial cordon?
DAFPT.answer: Incident Commander
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

DAFPT.question: Explain when a person charged with driving under the influence may be released?
DAFPT.answer: Until eight hours have elapsed from the time the person was taken into custody. Until the person's blood-alcohol level or breath-alcohol level is less than 0.05. No longer under the influence of alcoholic beverages or any chemical substance
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM DRUNK/IMPAIRED DRIVING ENFORCEMENT - 45 SF OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.4-8.4.3.4

DAFPT.question: What documents will be considered when allowing the removal of government property from the installation?
DAFPT.answer: Bill of Lading, AF IMT 1297, other shipping documents
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM GOVERNMENT PROPERTY AND CARGO CLEARANCE FORMS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.6-9.6.4

DAFPT.question: Define the CCSFS North Sector
DAFPT.answer: From Traffic Control Point (TCP) 25N to the east on Phillips Parkway through Complex 34 to the beach, north along the beach to the north boundary, west to incorporate the entire ITL area, the entire Complex 41 area and support buildings, south along ITL road back to TCP 25 N and all areas in between.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

DAFPT.question: Define the CCSFS Industrial Sector.
DAFPT.answer: From TCP 25 N east on Phillips Parkway through Complex 34 to the beach, then south along the beach to Camera Road A, west to Pier Road, then south to TCP 7 along Flight Control Road, (not to include NAVSTAR Processing Complex (NPC) area), to Phillips Parkway to TCP 10, west to the Indian River and all areas in between.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

DAFPT.question: Define the CCSFS South Sector.
DAFPT.answer: North boundary of the South Sector is east from the Banana River to TCP 10 at Phillips Parkway, south to Flight Control Road to the east to TCP 7 (to include the NPC area), north to Camera Road A east to the beach, south along the beach to include the entire Navy Port Area, Pass and ID and Deas Gate, from Deas Gate to the north of the Banana River along the shoreline
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

DAFPT.question: Define PSFB Zone A.
DAFPT.answer: Zone A is from the stone fence perimeter separating north housing and the suburb of Cocoa Beach, south to the Fire Dept., west to the west side of runway 03/21, southwest to the Banana River south of Famcamp, north along the shoreline to the stone fence. This zone includes the Chevron Park, 750 Ramp, DEOMI, and North Housing and is known as the industrial area.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

DAFPT.question: Define PSFB Zone B
DAFPT.answer: Zone B is from the Fire Department south to the stone wall at the corner of A1A and Pineda Causeway, west to the end of the marina, north up the shoreline to the south of Famcamp, northeast to west of runway 03/21, east to the Fire Department. This includes south gate, central housing, Air Force Technical Application Center
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

DAFPT.question: Define PSFB Zone C
DAFPT.answer: Zone C is from the north end of the beach access areas east of the stone fence perimeter separating north housing and the suburb of Cocoa Beach, south to Pineda Beach. This zone also encompasses the Tides Collocated Club and Pelican Coast, south housing area. The Landings at Patrick, which includes the Chapel, Shark Center, Youth Center and ball fields and is bounded by a wall on the north separating the housing area from South Patrick Shores, SR A1A on the east side, the wall on the south side near Satellite High School, and by South Patrick Drive.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3

DAFPT.question: Define a major traffic accident.
DAFPT.answer: A major traffic accident is any accident involving a fatality, injury or property damage above the amount established by installation commanders.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TRAFFIC ACCIDENT INVESTIGATION - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 29

DAFPT.question: What document is issued to civilian offenders suspected of shoplifting?
DAFPT.answer: CVB Form 1805
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LARCENY/SHOPLIFTING PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 3 Para Response to Shoplifting

DAFPT.question: Workplace Violence Type 1 is defined as __________
DAFPT.answer: A violent act by criminals who have no other connection with the workplace, but to commit robbery or another crime.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKPLACE/SCHOOL/CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER VIOLENCE RESPONSE - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 10

DAFPT.question: Workplace Violence Type 3 is defined as __________
DAFPT.answer: Violence against coworkers, supervisors, or managers by a present or former employee.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKPLACE/SCHOOL/CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER VIOLENCE RESPONSE - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 10

DAFPT.question: Workplace Violence Type 4 is defined as __________
DAFPT.answer: Violence is committed in the workplace by someone who doesn't work there, but has a personal relationship with an employee, an abusive spouse, or domestic partner.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKPLACE/SCHOOL/CHILD DEVELOPMENT CENTER VIOLENCE RESPONSE - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 10

DAFPT.question: If a non-military members entering or exiting the installation refuses to consent to a RIEVC, what must you do?
DAFPT.answer: Advise individual that refusal will result in denial of base access and may result in the loss of base driving privileges and/or debarment action and conduct a walk around inspection for signs of contraband in plain view.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RANDOM INSTALLATION ENTRY/EXIT VEHICLE CHECKS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.2-8.2.2.2

DAFPT.question: If RIEVC consent is not secured and contraband is discovered during a walkaround inspection of a vehicle, what must you do?
DAFPT.answer: If contraband is found, detain personnel, seize the contraband as evidence, secure the vehicle, and seek search authority.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RANDOM INSTALLATION ENTRY/EXIT VEHICLE CHECKS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.2-8.2.2.2

DAFPT.question: Roadblocks must provide the suspect the opportunity to stop. Roadblocks will not be established where?
DAFPT.answer: Curves, bridges, or areas where visibility of the roadblock is hindered.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ROADBLOCK PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5.5.

DAFPT.question: The Stinger Spike system will only be deployed in areas that afford the deploying officer what?
DAFPT.answer: a protected position
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM STINGER SPIKE SYSTEM PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5.4.

DAFPT.question: Avoid placing the Stinger system near what areas?
DAFPT.answer: intersections, railroad crossings, pedestrian crossings, or highly populated and unprotected areas such as ball fields, running tracks, etc.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM STINGER SPIKE SYSTEM PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5.4.

DAFPT.question: How is the duress activated utilizing a RA card reader?
DAFPT.answer: When using card readers, adding one number to the Personal Identification Number (PIN) will automatically signal a duress situation to the BDOC.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What technique is used to facilitate emergency entry into an SF posted RA?
DAFPT.answer: Sign/countersign
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the maximum response time to the NAOC when notified by BDOC?
DAFPT.answer: 10 minutes
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Explain response time by the ISRT to a PL2 resource?
DAFPT.answer: 5 minutes
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the maximum response time to a PL-3 resource on CCSFS by an ESRT?
DAFPT.answer: 15 minutes
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the maximum response time to a PL-3 resource on PSFB by a patrol?
DAFPT.answer: 10 minutes
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the 750 Ramp?
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for Skid Strip (when posted)
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What Act/Law prevents Air Force personnel from executing the laws of the states or the laws of the U.S. except when acting under the authority of the U.S. Constitution, an Act of Congress or under the direction of the President of the United States.
DAFPT.answer: The Posse Comitatus Act
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 51 Posse Comitatus Act

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Hearsay.'
DAFPT.answer: 'Hearsay' is a statement, other than the one made by the declarant while testifying at the trial or hearing, offered in evidence to prove the truth of the matter asserted.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'declarant.'
DAFPT.answer: A 'declarant' is a person who makes a statement.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'search.'
DAFPT.answer: A search is an examination of a person, property or premises to uncover evidence of a crime or criminal intent, such as stolen goods, burglary tools and weapons.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'statement.'
DAFPT.answer: A 'statement' is (1) an oral or written assertion or (2) nonverbal conduct of a person, if it is intended by the person as an assertion.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Protective Frisk.'
DAFPT.answer: A Defender may perform a protective frisk during a lawful stop when the member reasonably believes a person is armed and presently dangerous to the member or others.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Covered Wagon.'
DAFPT.answer: COVERED WAGON reports inform HHQ that an unusual incident affecting PL 1, 2, or 3 resources, probably or actually hostile, occurred at an installation or dispersed site.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 2 Resource Security, CH2. SECURITY REPORTING AND ALERTING SYSTEM.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Code 4'
DAFPT.answer: Request Wants and Warrants - Used to obtain a background check on a specific person or vehicle.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Code 9'
DAFPT.answer: Switch Frequencies - Used to direct the switching of radio frequencies.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Code 12'
DAFPT.answer: Duress - Refers to any duress situation.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Code 16'
DAFPT.answer: Alarm Activation - Used to initiate an alarm activation.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

DAFPT.question: Define an Active Duress
DAFPT.answer: Active duress may be indicated by the use of electronic duress alarms to covertly advise another location/unit of a duress situation. Without alerting the person(s) causing the duress, that the alarm has been sounded. Other examples of active duress indicators include the passing of the wing duress word or failing to properly authenticate via the authentication code.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: Define a Passive Duress
DAFPT.answer: Passive Duress. Passive duress is three consecutive failures to respond to your radio call sign.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: Where does the CCSFS BDOC duress alarm annunciate?
DAFPT.answer: XY Facility
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: Where does the PSFB ECC duress alarm annunciate?
DAFPT.answer: PSFB Command Post
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: What is the alternate channel used when notified of a Code 9?
DAFPT.answer: A Net - Channel 3
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

DAFPT.question: What form is utilized to assist in capturing vital information during a telephone bomb threat?
DAFPT.answer: AF Form 440, Bomb Threat Aid
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Bomb Threat: Ensure radio transmissions are not made within _______ (distance) of the affected area.
DAFPT.answer: 50 feet
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Active Shooter - Phase 1
DAFPT.answer: Neutralize the threat(s)
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Covered Wagon'
DAFPT.answer: COVERED WAGON reports inform HHQ that an unusual incident affecting PL 1, 2, or 3 resources, probably or actually hostile, occurred at an installation or dispersed site.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COVERED WAGON PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v3 Chap 2. Security Reporting and Alerting System

DAFPT.question: What actions must you take during a launch mishap?
DAFPT.answer: Clearing Officers and all others on-duty take immediate cover in assigned vehicle, guard houses or other available shelter. All TCPs must remain hard down unless they feel their life is in danger, at which time they will leave the vehicle barriers in place, proceed to a pre-determined launch shelter, and notify the LOS upon arrival.
DAFPT.ref: XPLAIN LAUNCH OPERATIONS GENERAL INFORMATION - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.2.1-4.4.2

DAFPT.question: What document is utilized to aid in the purge of the FCA/BDA?
DAFPT.answer: Man-load list
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LAUNCH CLEARING OFFICER DUTIES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.1.3-4.1.3.5

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Hard Down'
DAFPT.answer: Ensure no one enters the area unless they are cleared through BDOC, Whiskey Control, and/or the LOS or the SL.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM LAUNCH OPERATIONS POSTED TCP DUTIES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 4 Para 4.1.5-4.1.5.6

DAFPT.question: CCSFS Taxi Cab Entry: Explain
DAFPT.answer: Taxi cabs are not authorized unless approved by the Det-1 CC.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM INSTALLATION ACCESS GENERAL REQUIREMENTS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.7-9.7.3.2

DAFPT.question: PSFB: Explain Taxi, food delivery, and courtesy vehicles.
DAFPT.answer: Delivery, courtesy, and taxi drivers shall have sponsor's name, phone number, and address prior to requesting entry. All delivery personnel must have a current NCIC/DBIDS background check and valid reason for entry before access can authorized. Once verified, the driver's information and vehicle is annotated on the AF Form 1109, Visitor Register Log.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM INSTALLATION ACCESS GENERAL REQUIREMENTS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.7-9.7.3.2

DAFPT.question: Explain Civilian Law Enforcement Entry (non-emergency).
DAFPT.answer: All federal, state and local agencies acting in an official capacity are authorized entry with their agency credential. This includes, but not limited to, law enforcement, medical and fire departments.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM INSTALLATION PERIMETER ACCESS CONTROL DUTIES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 4

DAFPT.question: Explain Escorting Policy (installation access) on CCSFS.
DAFPT.answer: Escorting is currently not allowed on CCSFS, unless pre-coordinated with 45 SFS, typically in the form of an Installation Access List, or proper use of a CCSFS placard.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM INSTALLATION PERIMETER ACCESS CONTROL DUTIES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 4

DAFPT.question: Explain Escorting Policy (installation access) on PSFB.
DAFPT.answer: Military, DoD civilians, military retirees and adult dependents with a valid credential have escort authority. Dependent minors, age 17 and below, may escort visitors upon approval of the on-duty 45 SFS Flight Sergeant or higher authority.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM INSTALLATION PERIMETER ACCESS CONTROL DUTIES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 4

DAFPT.question: British Visiting Vessels - Allow entry to crew members of visiting British vessels utilizing their Military ID Card which is checked against the _________
DAFPT.answer: Installation Access List (IAL), Crew List, or visiting vessel badge.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM INSTALLATION ENTRY REQUIREMENTS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.7-9.8.9

DAFPT.question: Flight personnel are only authorized to issue AF IMT Form 75s for what period of time?
DAFPT.answer: 72 hours
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN TEMPORARY PASSES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.3-9.3.3

DAFPT.question: Prior to issuing any temporary pass, IECs shall request or accomplish what two activities?
DAFPT.answer: a NCIC/DBIDS background check from BDOC and check the 45 SW debarment, suspension and revocation listing.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN TEMPORARY PASSES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.3-9.3.3

DAFPT.question: Police, fire, or ambulance vehicles responding ______ or ______ will be allowed entry and validation for entry will be ascertained.
DAFPT.answer: 'Code 2' or 'Code 3'
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM EMERGENCY VEHICLE RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.9

DAFPT.question: The term ______ will be used when an individual deliberately drives past the IEC without being properly vetted.
DAFPT.answer: gate runner
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

DAFPT.question: When an individual deliberately drives past the IEC without being properly vetted, the IEC will immediately do what?
DAFPT.answer: For gates equipped with AVBs the IEC will immediately activate the EFO button.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

DAFPT.question: The deployment of the Stinger Spike System must be authorized by whom?
DAFPT.answer: Flight Sergeant
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

DAFPT.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE ONE: Periods of Increased Tension.
DAFPT.answer: The type of incidents which mark this phase may appear in the form of increased tension in living, dining and work areas.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

DAFPT.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE TWO: Scattered minor incidents of violence.
DAFPT.answer: Includes incidents of harassment between individual members of opposing groups.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

DAFPT.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE THREE: Group Oriented Violence.
DAFPT.answer: This phase is characterized by roaming assaults on lone individuals and/or fights with opposing groups, or assembly of personnel at base entry points.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

DAFPT.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE FIVE: After-Confrontation Phase.
DAFPT.answer: This phase is characterized by the cessation of confrontational activities and close out of all administrative and legal actions regarding the disturbance.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

DAFPT.question: At CCSFS, when would you deploy the Active Vehicle Barriers?
DAFPT.answer: Individual fails to stop for credential check; individual enters installation through outbound lane; individual fails to turn around and exit installation as directed (if determined to be a threat)
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM VEHICLE BARRIER OPERATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.4-9.4.3

DAFPT.question: What are the inspection procedures for vehicles carrying sealed flight hardware?
DAFPT.answer: For vehicles carrying sealed flight hardware, inspect inside the cab and unsealed areas. Sealed compartments are exempt from inspection.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COMMERCIAL VEHICLE INSPECTION GATE PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 11 Para 11.1-11.2.4.7

DAFPT.question: What documents will be considered when allowing the removal of government property from the installation?
DAFPT.answer: Bill of Lading, AF IMT 1297, other shipping documents
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM GOVERNMENT PROPERTY AND CARGO CLEARANCE FORMS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.6-9.6.4

DAFPT.question: If a non-military members entering or exiting the installation refuses to consent to a RIEVC, what must you do?
DAFPT.answer: Advise individual that refusal will result in denial of base access and may result in the loss of base driving privileges and/or debarment action and conduct a walk around inspection for signs of contraband in plain view.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RANDOM INSTALLATION ENTRY/EXIT VEHICLE CHECKS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.2-8.2.2.2

DAFPT.question: If RIEVC consent is not secured and contraband is discovered during a walkaround inspection of a vehicle, what must you do?
DAFPT.answer: If contraband is found, detain personnel, seize the contraband as evidence, secure the vehicle, and seek search authority.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RANDOM INSTALLATION ENTRY/EXIT VEHICLE CHECKS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 8 Para 8.2-8.2.2.2

DAFPT.question: Who grants written permission to restricted areas within the SLD 45?
DAFPT.answer: SLD CC or designee
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: In order to enter a RA unescorted, the individual requesting entry must have one of the following:
DAFPT.answer: An authenticated EAL matching an /RAB from another installation. Air Crew Orders with associated CAC. A RAB and pin code with the appropriate area open for site access.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: In addition to personal recognition, name three other supporting techniques for unescorted entry.
DAFPT.answer: Signature and Credential Check. EAL. Telephone or Radio Verification.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: True or False: All personnel issued an RAB are trained as an escort.
DAFPT.answer: True
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: True or False: An escort official may designate a properly badged person in the area to act as subordinate escort acting on their behalf.
DAFPT.answer: True
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Vehicles driven by visitors are inspected by the escort official unless _______ is implemented, at which time the 45 SFS will conduct the searches.
DAFPT.answer: FPCON Charlie
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What form is utilized to maintain a record of unescorted access to a Restricted Area?
DAFPT.answer: AF Form 1109
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Describe the Restricted Area Visitor Badge.
DAFPT.answer: RAVBs are identified by a large BLACK “V” with a RED background, in the photo block and the words “ESCORT REQUIRED” in the name of holder block of the badge
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: 'T' Badges are utilzed where and for what purpose?
DAFPT.answer: 'T' badges are only authorized at the Morrell Operations Center for visitors who require unescorted entry and are working at the facility for less than 90 days
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: How is the duress activated utilizing a RA card reader?
DAFPT.answer: When using card readers, adding one number to the Personal Identification Number (PIN) will automatically signal a duress situation to the BDOC.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Under what circumstances do SF members search vehicles/hand-carried items at RA's?
DAFPT.answer: FPCON Charlie or higher
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: RA duress codes are valid for how long?
DAFPT.answer: Six months, unless compromised
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: During normal security operations (FPCON NORMAL/ALPHA/BRAVO) who is responsible for vehicle inspections prior to RA entry?
DAFPT.answer: The properly badged vehicle operator
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Vehicles driven by visitors into a RA are inspected by whom?
DAFPT.answer: The escort official.
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What technique is used to facilitate emergency entry into an SF posted RA?
DAFPT.answer: Sign/countersign
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the 750 Ramp?
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the SLC 37
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the VIF
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the MOC Perimeter
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the XY Perimeter
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for the RCF Perimeter
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for SLC 39A
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for SLC 40
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for CCF
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for GPS
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: What is the area designator on the RAB for Skid Strip (when posted)
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM WORKING IN RESTRICTED/CONTROLLED AREAS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: Free zones are established within RA's under whose authority?
DAFPT.answer: SLD 45/CC
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN FREE ZONE REQUIREMENTS - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 6

DAFPT.question: RA Group Tours are pre-announced by _______
DAFPT.answer: BDOC
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM GROUP TOUR PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 10 Para 10.5

DAFPT.question: RA Group Tours larger than ______ are authorized ESS by-pass.
DAFPT.answer: two
DAFPT.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM GROUP TOUR PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 10 Para 10.5

DAFPT.question: What Act/Law prevents Air Force personnel from executing the laws of the states or the laws of the U.S. except when acting under the authority of the U.S. Constitution, an Act of Congress or under the direction of the President of the United States.
DAFPT.answer: The Posse Comitatus Act
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 51 Posse Comitatus Act

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Hearsay.'
DAFPT.answer: 'Hearsay' is a statement, other than the one made by the declarant while testifying at the trial or hearing, offered in evidence to prove the truth of the matter asserted.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'declarant.'
DAFPT.answer: A 'declarant' is a person who makes a statement.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'search.'
DAFPT.answer: A search is an examination of a person, property or premises to uncover evidence of a crime or criminal intent, such as stolen goods, burglary tools and weapons.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'statement.'
DAFPT.answer: A 'statement' is (1) an oral or written assertion or (2) nonverbal conduct of a person, if it is intended by the person as an assertion.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Define the term 'Protective Frisk.'
DAFPT.answer: A Defender may perform a protective frisk during a lawful stop when the member reasonably believes a person is armed and presently dangerous to the member or others.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 1 General Knowledge, CH 54 RULES OF EVIDENCE.

DAFPT.question: Who can validate/authenticate EAL's?
DAFPT.answer: A SF supervisor, (E-5/GS-7 or above or other designated civilian equivalent) will be responsible for validating and authenticating the EAL.
DAFPT.ref: SFTRG 2 Operations VOL 2 Access Control, CH10. ENTRY AUTHORITY LISTS.
